original: Brinck, Tore Gustaf Edvard Erik-son, bergsingenjör, Norrköping, f. 12/ 7/85 i Avesta av brukskass. Erik Adolf Erikson o. Elisabeth Maria Thérèse Brinck. G. 15 m. Thérèse Cowes. Barn: Edvard f. 16, ing., Marie-Louise 19, gift Svereus, Curt 24, ing. o. kadett. — Mog:ex. i Örebro 04, KTH (H) 04-08. Bessemer- o. martining. v. Witkowitz Eisenwerk i Österr. 09-13’, förest, f. Motala Verkstads mar-tin- o. valsverk 13-15, ing. v. Domn-arfvets Jernverks thomas-, martin- o. elektrostålverk 15-18, disp:assist. v. Dahlkarlshytte A-B 18-23, förste ing. v. Laxå o. Röfors Bruk 23-26, inneh. av ing-.firman Tore Brinck i Norrköp. sed. 26. Led. av Sv. teknifören. sed. 06, v. ordf. i dess första isekt. sed. 08. Hobbies: jakt, fiske, rosenodling.
translated: Brinck, Tore Gustaf Edvard Erikson, mining engineer, Norrköping, born on July 12th, 1885 in Avesta, the son of a mill cashier, Erik Adolf Erikson and Elisabeth Maria Thérèse Brinck. Married in 1915 to Thérèse Cowes. Children: Edvard born in 1916, engineer, Marie-Louise born in 1919, married to Svereus, Curt born in 1924, engineer and cadet. Graduated from Örebro Technical School in 1904, KTH (H) from 1904-1908. Worked at Bessemer- and Martin-works in Witkowitz Eisenwerk in Austria from 1909-1913, was the supervisor for Motala Works' martin- and rolling mills from 1913-1915, engineer at Domnarvet's Jernverk's thomas-, martin- and electrosteel mills from 1915-1918, assistant executive at Dahlkarlshytte A-B from 1918-1923, first engineer at Laxå and Röfors Bruk from 1923-1926, and then had his own engineering firm named Tore Brinck in Norrköping since 1926. Became a member of the Swedish Society of Engineering in 1906 and was vice president of its first section in 1908. Hobbies include hunting, fishing, and rose gardening.

worksFor.name: Motala Works
worksFor.jobTitle: Supervisor for martin- and rolling mills
